words.definition: An adolescent is a young person or a teenager.
words.example: The adolescent was excited about getting a skateboard for his birthday.

words.definition: Aptitude is a natural ability or skill.
words.example: He has a natural aptitude for water skiing.

words.definition: To compliment is to say a nice thing about someone or something.
words.example: Her co-worker complimented her for doing a good job.

words.definition: To hinder is to keep someone or something from doing something.
words.example: All the traffic hindered me from getting to work on time.

words.definition: Journalism is the work of collecting the news to put in newspapers or on TV.
words.example: Before becoming a teacher, she worked in journalism.

words.definition: A jury is a group of people that listen to a trial and say if someone is guilty.
words.example: The jury listened closely to the attorney before they made their decision.

words.definition: Justice is fairness in the way that you treat other people.
words.example: People turn to the court system when they are seeking justice.

words.definition: Liberty is freedom to do what you want.
words.example: To many people, the Statue of Liberty is a symbol of freedom.

words.definition: If someone or something is literary, it is involved with literature in some way.
words.example: He worked hard to create a successful literary career.

words.definition: A pharmacy is a place where medicine is sold.
words.example: My mother sells medicine to people at the pharmacy.

words.definition: A pill is a small object that has medicine inside.
words.example: She took a pill for her headache.

words.definition: To presume is to believe something is true without being certain.
words.example: Since he raised his hand, the teacher presumed he knew the answer.

words.definition: To have privacy is to be away from other people.
words.example: Please hang the sign on the door so we can have some privacy.

words.definition: A punishment is something that one must endure for any wrongdoing.
words.example: He was given a punishment for being rude to the teacher.

words.definition: If someone is sensible, they make good decisions.
words.example: It was sensible for him to bring an umbrella.

words.definition: A slice is a piece from something larger, such as a cake.
words.example: The man ate a slice of pizza.

words.definition: Sorrow is a very sad feeling.
words.example: The loss of her car created much sorrow.

words.definition: A straw is a thin tube used for drinking.
words.example: I drank the orange juice through a straw.

words.definition: To swell is to become larger and rounder.
words.example: After he got hit in the eye, it began to swell.

words.definition: When something is tidy, it is clean and in order.
words.example: Leon has always been a very tidy boy.
